p: COG7 (Component of Oligomeric Golgi Complex 7) encodes a protein integral to Golgi apparatus function, which is essential for protein glycosylation and trafficking. Disruptions in Golgi function have been implicated in various neurodegenerative disorders, including Alzheimer’s disease. Mutations in COG7 are associated with Congenital Disorders of Glycosylation (CDG)32, which frequently manifest with neurological impairments. Abnormal glycosylation processes have been implicated in Alzheimer’s disease pathology, particularly affecting tau protein processing and amyloid precursor protein (APP) metabolism33.
